Representing single cell data in R / Bioconductor

A_SingleCellDataRepresentation.Rmd

Objectives:

  • Introduce SingleCellExperiment, the central data representation for single cell data in R / Bioconductor.
  • Explore the structure of SingleCellExperiment, and the basic operations used to manipulate SingleCellExperiment.
  • Introduce downstream resources, and resources for converting bewteen other single cell data representations.

The SingleCellExperiment

library(SingleCellExperiment)

Example data

library(TENxPBMCData)
  • Another excellent resource for curated single-cell data sets – scRNAseq.
sce <- TENxPBMCData("pbmc4k")
## snapshotDate(): 2020-10-02
## see ?TENxPBMCData and browseVignettes('TENxPBMCData') for documentation
## loading from cache
sce

## metadata(0):

Components of the SingleCellExperiment

The ‘counts’ matrix

counts(sce)
## <33694 x 4340> matrix of class DelayedMatrix and type "integer":
##                    [,1]    [,2]    [,3]    [,4] ... [,4337] [,4338] [,4339]
## ENSG00000243485       0       0       0       0   .       0       0       0
## ENSG00000237613       0       0       0       0   .       0       0       0
## ENSG00000186092       0       0       0       0   .       0       0       0
## ENSG00000238009       0       0       0       0   .       0       0       0
## ENSG00000239945       0       0       0       0   .       0       0       0
##             ...       .       .       .       .   .       .       .       .
## ENSG00000277856       0       0       0       0   .       0       0       0
## ENSG00000275063       0       0       0       0   .       0       0       0
## ENSG00000271254       0       0       0       0   .       0       0       0
## ENSG00000277475       0       0       0       0   .       0       0       0
## ENSG00000268674       0       0       0       0   .       0       0       0
##                 [,4340]
## ENSG00000243485       0
## ENSG00000237613       0
## ENSG00000186092       0
## ENSG00000238009       0
## ENSG00000239945       0
##             ...       .
## ENSG00000277856       0
## ENSG00000275063       0
## ENSG00000271254       0
## ENSG00000277475       0
## ENSG00000268674       0
  • Gene (rows) by cell (columns) matrix of raw counts.
  • ‘DelayedMatrix’: on-disk representation, so very large data sets can be represented and manipulated.

Essential manipulations

mean(counts(sce) == 0)            # proportion of zeros
## [1] 0.9608314
  • Proportion of 0’s? Access the counts, determine whether each entry in the matrix is a ‘zero’, and calculate the mean.
hist(log10(colSums(counts(sce)))) # 'library size'

  • Distribution of ‘library sizes’? Sum each column and draw a histogram, using log10() transformed values.

Annotation

head(rowData(sce), 3)
## DataFrame with 3 rows and 3 columns
##                      ENSEMBL_ID  Symbol_TENx      Symbol
##                     <character>  <character> <character>
## ENSG00000243485 ENSG00000243485 RP11-34P13.3          NA
## ENSG00000237613 ENSG00000237613      FAM138A     FAM138A
## ENSG00000186092 ENSG00000186092        OR4F5       OR4F5
  • Rich possibilities for gene and cell annotation
library(dplyr)
colData(sce) %>%
    as_tibble() %>%
    head(3)
## # A tibble: 3 x 11
##   Sample Barcode Sequence Library Cell_ranger_ver… Tissue_status Barcode_type
##   <chr>  <chr>   <chr>      <int> <chr>            <chr>         <chr>       
## 1 pbmc4k AAACCT… AAACCTG…       1 v2.1             <NA>          Chromium    
## 2 pbmc4k AAACCT… AAACCTG…       1 v2.1             <NA>          Chromium    
## 3 pbmc4k AAACCT… AAACCTG…       1 v2.1             <NA>          Chromium    
## # … with 4 more variables: Chemistry <chr>, Sequence_platform <chr>,
## #   Individual <chr>, Date_published <chr>
  • Can play well enough with other analysis paradigms in R, e.g., tidyverse use of pipes and tibbles.

Subsetting

ridx <- rowSums(counts(sce)) > 0 # rows with non-zero counts
sce[ridx,]                       # select rows, all columns
## class: SingleCellExperiment 
## dim: 19773 4340 
## metadata(0):
## assays(1): counts
## rownames(19773): ENSG00000238009 ENSG00000239945 ... ENSG00000276345
##   ENSG00000271254
## rowData names(3): ENSEMBL_ID Symbol_TENx Symbol
## colnames: NULL
## colData names(11): Sample Barcode ... Individual Date_published
## reducedDimNames(0):
## altExpNames(0):
  • Coordinated row- and column- subsetting, using a ‘matrix’-like metaphore.
  • For example, selecting only rows with non-zero counts in at least one cell.

Additional information in a SingleCellExperiment

  • Reduced dimension calculations

What do do with a SingleCellExperiment?

  • Check out ‘Orchestrating Single Cell Analysis with Bioconductor’!

Other representations

  • zelkonverter provides methods to convert between SingleCellExperiment and Python’s AnnData representation.
  • Converters bewtween R’s [Seurat][] package are also available.

Summary

  • The [SingleCellExperiment][] is a central object for representing single cell experiments (including very large experiments) in R / Bioconductor.
  • SingleCellExperiment combines count matrices with annotations on rows and columns, as well as derived measures such as dimensionality reductions.
  • SingleCellExperiment can play well enough with other paradigms in R, e.g., the tibble and tidyverse.
  • ‘Orchestrating Single Cell Analysis with Bioconductor’ provides an amazing resource for opportunities for down-stream analysis.
  • The SingleCellExperiment can be converted ot other popular formats, for instance Python’s AnnData.
